chapter.title: Readers
chapter.para: In this part of the administration tab, you can define your personal useful options for managing readers.

sect1.title: Categories
sect1.para: Defining multiple reader categories permits calculating statistics on how your library is being used. For more information on calculating statistics with PMB, refer to PMB User's Guide, Chapter Editing.

If you have activated management of advanced quotas, the categories will enable you to specify quotas: for example a kid can borrow 2 works, an adult 5 works at the same time. For more information on advanced quotas management, refer to chapter .
In France, the maintenance of a reader's file in a library is limited to one year, when the file is declared (mandatory declaration to the CNIL) with a simplified procedure.
If you want to be exempt from this limit, you could for example change the membership time to 9999 days.
Note if you have activated the readers financial management, you can define a membership rate by reader category, available here in the third column. For more information, refer to chapter .

sect1.para: Statistical codes enable production of information about your readers by crossing data.

sect1.title: Readers Import
sect1.para: Importing a reader file requires getting information from another program or file that would otherwise be available. laboratory members with a specialized documentation center, student list of a teaching establishment, export from a LDAP directory, etc...
From the readers import screen you can import readers from a file or delete readers.

sect2.title: Importing Readers
sect2.para: Import is done from a text file (mostly TXT or CSV type files). Spreadsheet programs (OpenOffice, Excel, ...) can export files in a CSV format.

Click on Browse to select the file to import. According to your file format, select a fields separator. Select also a readers category and a statistical code: this information cannot be imported directly.
Click Next to continue.
The following screen displays le list of fields of the readers table.
In the left column appears the fields name of the database. Information about readers will be entered in these fields.
In the center column you will find the position of the field in the file.

The right column represents an example of the first line of the file, it can be very useful when you want to change the position within the file. Enter the positions in the center column, and don't forget to click on Update to update the changes.
Here is an example of a file to be imported:
12527 is the first position, it represents the reader's bar code, the second position is the reader's name, the third represents the address, etc....
Important the red fields are non-modifiable fields by the user, they will be filled automatically.
After filling up you corresponding table click on Next.
Finally the number of persons treated by the readers import is displayed.

sect2.title: Deleting readers
sect2.para: You can delete readers by clicking on the Delete Readers button. Then checkmark the expiration date(s) of the readers to be deleted, for example those whose expiration date is more that one year.
Click Delete.
The list of the corresponding readers is displayed.
You can then click on Delete All to delete the corresponding readers.
The number of deleted persons is displayed. Those that could not be deleted, for example because they are currently borrowing a work, are displayed.

sect2.title: Advanced solutions for importing readers
sect2.para: Advanced solutions for importing readers are available.

Imported readers will be sorted into existing categories. If you wish to set your imports more finely. you can use phpmyadmin or link your data in an application using MyODBC. For more information on phpmyadmin, refer to the web site phpmyadmin or, for more information on the installation [in French] refer to http://www.allhtml.com/mysql/mysql582.php.

MyODBC is an ODBC application, it allows editing of MySQL data within your database application, allowing for example to copy and paste data from a spreadsheet. For more information, refer to www.mysql.com or perform a google search on MyODBC.

sect1.title: Customized parameters
sect1.para: Customized parameters allow adding complementary information to reader cards. You can thereby specify information such as company, socio-professional category....
You must specify a name for your parameter (accentuated letters and punctuation are not accepted in the field name, but you can use them in the display title).
You can specify this parameter to be a mandatory entry.
Operations of the customizable parameters is identical to the customized fields for copies and bibliographical notes. For more information, refer to .
